column2: UTAH PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 2. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.

column2: 4. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 5. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.

column2: 6. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column10: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 7. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
8. This traffic sign warns you about:
column8: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 9. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
11. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 12. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
14. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 15. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
16. A motorist arriving at the intersection must yield the right of way to motorists who arrived before him.
17. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 18. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
19. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 21. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column10: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

24. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane orÂ guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
25. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
